message:
WEEK 1 — Movement Pattern Introduction

Your first week of training. Focus: learn fundamental movement patterns (squat, hinge, push, pull) with light loads. Keep it conservative—every rep is a learning opportunity.

This Week:
- Mon: Full body (lower emphasis)
- Tue: Rest
- Wed: Full body (upper emphasis)
- Thu: Rest
- Fri: Full body (balanced)
- Sat: Active recovery (optional)
- Sun: Rest

Intensity: RPE 5-6 (light weight)
Volume: 2 sets x 12-15 reps

Expect some soreness as your body adapts—that's normal. If something hurts (not burns), stop and modify. You're building the foundation!
qualityNotes: Week title on Line 1 (all caps for emphasis)

message:
WEEK 5 — Progressive Overload Begins

You've completed form mastery! Now we add weight when you hit 3x15 reps with perfect form. Track your lifts—you'll need those numbers to know when to progress.

This Week:
- Mon: Full body (lower emphasis)
- Tue: Rest
- Wed: Full body (upper emphasis)
- Thu: Rest
- Fri: Full body (balanced)
- Sat: Active recovery (optional)
- Sun: Rest

Intensity: RPE 6-7 (moderate challenge)
Volume: 3 sets x 12-15 reps

Movements should feel familiar now. Your focus shifts from learning the pattern to challenging the muscles. Write down your weights after each session!
qualityNotes: Clear progression instruction (track lifts, add weight at 3x15)
Intensity/volume updated to reflect new phase

message:
WEEK 9 — Barbell Lifts Begin

You're ready for the big three: back squat, bench press, deadlift. Start light (just the bar or bar + 10-20lbs) to learn the new patterns. Film your lifts if possible—barbell technique matters.

This Week:
- Mon: Full body (barbell squat intro)
- Tue: Rest
- Wed: Full body (barbell bench intro)
- Thu: Rest
- Fri: Full body (barbell deadlift intro)
- Sat: Active recovery (optional)
- Sun: Rest

Intensity: RPE 6-7 (light weight for learning)
Volume: 3 sets x 10-12 reps

Barbells feel different than dumbbells—more stability demand. Weight is secondary this week. Master the movement first.
qualityNotes: Day descriptions updated to reflect barbell introduction
